db:abstract.db:para: This application demonstrates how to use XmlListModel as a datasource for a Chart.

db:section.db:title: Running the Example
db:section.db:para: To run the example from Qt Creator, open the Welcome mode and select the example from Examples. For more information, visit Building and Running an Example.

db:section.db:title: Using List Models as Data Sources
db:section.db:para: Let's define an empty ChartView first:
db:section.db:programlisting: ChartView { id: chartView title: "Driver Speeds, lap 1" anchors.fill: parent legend.alignment: Qt.AlignTop animationOptions: ChartView.SeriesAnimations antialiasing: true }
db:section.db:para: Our XmlListModel uses hard-coded test data. In a real application the data source would be a timing system.
The data is parsed with a timer. The line series representing each driver are created on the fly.
